data.description: Japan’s 2-year JGB auction saw a lowest price of 100.0950 and an average price of 100.1080, with 41.78% of bids accepted at the lowest price. The bid-to-cover ratio stood at 3.32, down from 3.88 in the previous auction.

data.title: Ransomware incidents rise by 50% in 2025, with payments stagnant. Report indicates attackers facing challenges for profits.
data.description: According to a recent report from Chainalysis, ransomware attackers are finding it increasingly challenging to generate profits, partly due to regulatory crackdowns and a growing number of victims refusing to pay. These factors have resulted in a decline in ransom proceeds for the attackers. The report highlights the effort ransomware attackers are putting into their activities relative to the diminishing returns they are now experiencing. This indicates a shift in the ransomware landscape, with attackers facing more obstacles in their attempts to cash in on their malicious activities.

data.title: Sen. Warren calls for transparency on Trump family's crypto bank application. She demands unredacted application for review.
data.description: Senator Elizabeth Warren (D-Massachusetts) raised questions during a Senate session regarding the Trump family's request to launch a stablecoin bank tied to their World Liberty Financial (CRYPTO: WLFI) platform. Senator Warren insisted on transparency during her interrogation of Comptroller of the Currency Jonathan Gould about whether all legal requirements were followed in the bank charter application submitted by World Liberty Financial, a company co-owned by President Donald Trump's children. As per OCC regulations, applicants must disclose all principal shareholders holding a minimum of a 10% direct or indirect interest in the proposed bank, with failure to comply leading to potential rejection. Senator Warren demanded access to the complete application to ensure that all necessary disclosures were included, along with Senator Tim Scott (R-South Carolina), who chairs the Banking Committee. For further details, the full article can be found on Benzinga.com.

data.title: Vitalik Buterin plans Ethereum's quantum-resilience strategy, focusing on 4 key areas for upgrades to handle future challenges.
data.description: A prominent figure in the Ethereum community highlighted the need for improvements in four key areas: validator signatures, data storage, user accounts, and proofs. However, implementing these changes is expected to be a challenging process.

data.title: Tidewater to announce earnings on March 2, 2026 (Three and twelve months ending December 31, 2025). Earnings call on March 3, 2026. CEO Quintin Kneen to discuss results.
data.description: Houston-based Tidewater Inc. (NYSE: TDW) is set to unveil its financial results for the fourth quarter and full year of 2025 on March 2, 2026. Following this release after market close, an earnings conference call will take place on March 3, 2026, at 8:00 a.m. Central Time. President and CEO, Quintin Kneen, will lead the discussion on the company's performance during the mentioned periods. This event will allow investors to gain insights into Tidewater's financial status at the end of the fiscal year.
